name: The Playful Page: A Sci-Fi Rom-Com Conversation - Toronto Games Week
description:
Holly Gramazio (game designer turned novelist) and Jim Munroe (novelist turned game designer) chat about writing, games, fiction, Jim's new graphic novel Zeroed Out, Holly's book about an attic full of endlessly spawning husbands -- and how The Husbands has been greenlit by Apple to be made into a TV series by A24 starring Juno Temple (Ted Lasso). Books on sale by Another Story.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Team Up Activated - Toronto Games Week
description:
Come join us at Invictus Game Station and play Marvel Rivals in 6v6 in-person e-sports style tournaments. From the setups to the prizes, meet new players and remember the power that games and people have together! With great raffle prizes from our sponsors BEACN, WakeWater & with your ticket, a chance to win a Xbox Series S!

name: IGDA Game Programmers Roundtable - Toronto Games Week
description:
Join us for an IGDA Toronto Roundtable at George Brown College with veteran game programmers from studios big and small. We will discuss their different career paths, how company size impacts their experience, tips and advice for newcomers, and more. After, we will go to the Great Lakes Brewpub for our traditional Meet & Mingle.

name: Papa’s Spinach Dumpling Making Class
description:
Celebrate Father’s Day through the tradition of handmade dumplings. Just like Popeye gets his strength from spinach, Dad powers through every day to protect, provide, and care for the family. 

This hands-on class is a chance to slow down, laugh, and create something special together, one spinach-shaped dumpling at a time. Make dumpling dough and Taiwanese-style filling from scratch,  fold dumplings into adorable spinach-leaf shapes - strong just like Dad! Take home your handmade dumplings, ready to cook or freeze. During the class, enjoy a taste of chilled Roselle Hibiscus Tea, a vibrant, floral tea loved by all ages.

name: Humber Valley Art Club Annual Members’ Juried Show Art Exhibition

address.streetAddress: 399 The West Mall - Etobicoke Civic Centre

description: This juried show celebrates the many artistic talents in the Etobicoke community by showcasing the very best recent works in a variety of media by the members of the Humber Valley Art Club.
